PIN.values:
|&cr;&lf;USAGE: tree-tagger {-options-} { {}}&cr;&lf;&cr;&lf;OPTIONS:&cr;&lf;&tab;-token:&tab;Print the token&cr;&lf;&tab;-lemma:&tab;Print the lemma&cr;&lf;&tab;-sgml:&tab;Don't tag SGML annotations&cr;&lf;&tab;-threshold

: Print all tags of a word with a probability higher than

times the largest probability&cr;&lf;&tab;-prob: Print tag probabilities&cr;&lf;&tab;-ignore-prefix: Ignore prefix when guessing pos for unknown words.&cr;&lf;&tab;-no-unknown: Print the token rather than for unknown lemmas&cr;&lf;&tab;-cap-heuristics:&tab;Look up unknown capitalized words in the list of lower-case words&cr;&lf;&tab;-hyphen-heuristics:&tab;Turn on the heuristics fur guessing the parts of speech of unknown hyphenated words&cr;&lf;&tab;-quiet:&tab;Don't print status messages&cr;&lf;&tab;-pt-with-lemma:&tab;pretagging with lemmata&cr;&lf;&tab;-pt-with-prob:&tab;pretagging with probabilities&cr;&lf;&tab;-files :&tab;Read names of input and output files pairwise from &cr;&lf;&tab;-lex :&tab;Read auxiliary lexicon entries from file &cr;&lf;&tab;-wc :&tab;Read a word-class automaton from file &cr;&lf;&tab;-eos-tag :&tab;The SGML tag signals the end of a sentence.&cr;&lf;&tab;&tab;&tab;This option implies the option -sgml&cr;&lf;&cr;&lf;Some more exotic options:&cr;&lf;&tab;-proto:&tab;Print lexical information for each word&cr;&lf;&tab;-gramotron: Same as -proto but with a different format&cr;&lf;&tab;-proto-with-prob: Same as -proto but with lexical tag probabilities&cr;&lf;&tab;-eps :&tab;Set minimal tag frequency to &cr;&lf;&tab;-base:&tab;Use only lexical probabilities for tagging&cr;&lf;&tab;-print-prob-tree: Print the transition probability tree and exit&cr;&lf;&tab;-print-suffix-tree: Print the suffix probabilities and exit&cr;&lf;&cr;&lf;|

|&cr;&lf;USAGE: tree-tagger {-options-} { {}}&cr;&lf;&cr;&lf;OPTIONS:&cr;&lf;&tab;-token:&tab;Print the token&cr;&lf;&tab;-lemma:&tab;Print the lemma&cr;&lf;&tab;-sgml:&tab;Don't tag SGML annotations&cr;&lf;&tab;-threshold

: Print all tags of a word with a probability higher than

times the largest probability&cr;&lf;&tab;-prob: Print tag probabilities&cr;&lf;&tab;-ignore-prefix: Ignore prefix when guessing pos for unknown words.&cr;&lf;&tab;-no-unknown: Print the token rather than for unknown lemmas&cr;&lf;&tab;-cap-heuristics:&tab;Look up unknown capitalized words in the list of lower-case words&cr;&lf;&tab;-hyphen-heuristics:&tab;Turn on the heuristics fur guessing the parts of speech of unknown hyphenated words&cr;&lf;&tab;-quiet:&tab;Don't print status messages&cr;&lf;&tab;-pt-with-lemma:&tab;pretagging with lemmata&cr;&lf;&tab;-pt-with-prob:&tab;pretagging with probabilities&cr;&lf;&tab;-files :&tab;Read names of input and output files pairwise from &cr;&lf;&tab;-lex :&tab;Read auxiliary lexicon entries from file &cr;&lf;&tab;-wc :&tab;Read a word-class automaton from file &cr;&lf;&tab;-eos-tag :&tab;The SGML tag signals the end of a sentence.&cr;&lf;&tab;&tab;&tab;This option implies the option -sgml&cr;&lf;&cr;&lf;Some more exotic options:&cr;&lf;&tab;-proto:&tab;Print lexical information for each word&cr;&lf;&tab;-gramotron: Same as -proto but with a different format&cr;&lf;&tab;-proto-with-prob: Same as -proto but with lexical tag probabilities&cr;&lf;&tab;-eps :&tab;Set minimal tag frequency to &cr;&lf;&tab;-base:&tab;Use only lexical probabilities for tagging&cr;&lf;&tab;-print-prob-tree: Print the transition probability tree and exit&cr;&lf;&tab;-print-suffix-tree: Print the suffix probabilities and exit&cr;&lf;&cr;&lf;|

|Noun, singular or mass|,|Noun, plural|,|Proper noun, singular|,|Proper noun, plural|,,Adjective,|Adjective, comparative |,|Adjective, superlative|,Adverb,|Adverb, comparative|,|Adverb, superlative|,,|Verb, base form|,|Verb, past tense|,|Verb, gerund or present participle|,|Verb, past participle|,|Verb, present tense, non-3rd person singular present|,|Verb, present tense, 3rd person singular present|,|Modal verb|,,|Article, Determiner|,|Personal pronoun|,|Possessive ending|,|Possessive pronoun|,|Wh-pronoun, possessive|,Predeterminer,,|Cardinal number|,,Wh-adverb,Wh-determiner,Wh-pronoun,,|Coordinating conjunction|,|Preposition, Subordinating conjunction |,|Preposition "to"|,,Particle,|Existential there|,|List item marker|,Symbol,|Interjection, Exclamation|,|Foreign word|,,,,,,,

|Noun, singular or mass|,|Noun, plural|,|Proper noun, singular, more specific (actual names)&cr;&lf;|,|Proper noun, plural, , more specific (actual names)&cr;&lf;|,,|Adjectives, not comp meaning, but with -er (like further details), Adjectives, comp without -er (like superior), Adjective, super without -est (like first, last, unsurpassed)|,|Adjectives, comp with -er (and more / less)|,|Adjective, super with -est (as well as worst, also most and least)|,|Adverb, most words with -ly, degree words (quite, too, very), posthead modifiers (enough, indeed), neg markers (not, n't & never), Adverb, with -er but without comp meaning (like later)|,|Adverb, comp -er|,|Adverb, super|,,|imperatives, infnitives and subjunctives (Imperative: Do it; Infinitive: You should do it, to do it; Subjunctive: We suggested that he do it)|,|Verb, past tense, includes the conditional form of the verb to be (I were...)|,|Verb, gerung or present participle|,|Verb, past participle|,|Verb, present tense, other than 3rd person singular|,|Verb, present tense, 3rd person singular|,|all verbs that don't take an -s ending in the third person singular present: can, could, (dare), may, might, must, ought, shal l, should, will, would|,,|articles (a(n), every, no, the), indefnite determiners (another, any, some, each, either, neither, that, these, this, those), instances of all and both (as in all roads or both times), such (such a good time)|,|personal pronouns (I, me, you, he, him, etc.), reflexive pronouns einding in -self or -selves, nominal pronouns (mine, yours, his, hers, ours, theirs)|,|possessive ending on nouns ending in 's or ' is split of by the tagging algorithm and tagged as if it were a separate word (John/NP 's/POS idea)|,|adjectival possessive forms my, your, his, her, its, one's, our and their|,whose,|all, both, half, many, nary, quite, rather, such|,,|Cardinal number|,,|how, where, why, when|,|which, what, as well as that when it is used as a relative pronoun|,|who, what, whom|,,|Coordinating conjunction (and, but, nor, or, yet), mathematical operators (plus, minus, less, times), over (="divided by"), for (="because")|,|no distinction between prepositions and subordinating conjunctions|,|the preposition to has its ow special tag whether it is a preposition or an infnitival marker|,,|Particle (along, away, back, by, down, forward, in, off, on, out, over, round, under, up)|,|Existential there is the unstressed there that triggers inversion of the inflected verb and the logical subject of a sentence|,|This category includes letters and numerals when they are used to identify items in a list|,|mathematical, scientific and technical symbols or expressions, names of chemicals, units of measurements|,|my (as in My, what a gorgeous day), oh, please, see (as in See, it's like this), uh, well and yes, among others|,|like bête noire and persona non grata|,,,,,,,

|personalpronomen: wer? who? I, you, he... me, you, him,...|
|possessivbegleiter: wessen? whose? mine, yours, his, hers, theirs,...|
|attribuierend = determiner&cr;&lf;modifies noun phrase (wessen Hut, whose, which)|
